value.halfverse: his mercy endures for ever.
value.verse: Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good; *

value.halfverse: “His mercy endures for ever.”
value.verse: Let Israel now proclaim, *
Let the house of Aaron now proclaim, *
value.halfverse: “His mercy endures for ever.”
“His mercy endures for ever.”
value.verse: Let those who fear the LORD now proclaim, *

value.halfverse: the LORD answered by setting me free.
value.verse: I called to the LORD in my distress; *

value.halfverse: what can anyone do to me?
value.verse: The LORD is at my side, therefore I will not fear; *

value.halfverse: I will triumph over those who hate me.
value.verse: The LORD is at my side to help me; *

value.halfverse: than to put any trust in flesh.
value.verse: It is better to rely on the LORD *
It is better to rely on the LORD *
value.halfverse: than to put any trust in rulers.
in the Name of the LORD I will repel them.
value.verse: All the ungodly encompass me; *

value.halfverse: in the name of the LORD I will repel them.
value.verse: They hem me in, they hem me in on every side; *

They swarm about me like bees;
they blaze like a fire of thorns; *
value.halfverse: in the name of the LORD I will repel them.
but the LORD came to my help.
value.verse: I was pressed so hard that I almost fell, *
The LORD is my strength and my song, *
value.halfverse: and he has become my salvation.

value.verse: There is a sound of exultation and victory *
value.halfverse: in the tents of the righteous:

value.verse: “The right hand of the LORD has triumphed! *
value.halfverse:
the right hand of the LORD is exalted!
 the right hand of the LORD has triumphed!”

value.verse: I shall not die, but live, *
value.halfverse: and declare the works of the LORD.

value.verse: The LORD has punished me sorely, *
value.halfverse: but he did not hand me over to death.

I will enter them;
 I will offer thanks to the LORD.
value.verse: Open for me the gates of righteousness; *

value.halfverse: he who is righteous may enter.”
value.verse: “This is the gate of the LORD; *

value.halfverse: and have become my salvation.
value.verse: I will give thanks to you, for you answered me *
The same stone which the builders rejected *
value.halfverse: has become the chief cornerstone.
and it is marvelous in our eyes.
value.verse: This is the LORD’S doing, *

value.halfverse: we will rejoice and be glad in it.
value.verse: On this day the LORD has acted; *

value.halfverse: LORD, send us now success.
value.verse: Hosanna, LORD, hosanna! *

value.halfverse: we bless you from the house of the LORD.
value.verse: Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord; *

value.halfverse: form a procession with branches up to the horns of the altar.
value.verse: God is the LORD; he has shined upon us; *
“You are my God, and I will thank you; *
value.halfverse: you are my God, and I will exalt you.”

value.verse: Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good; *
value.halfverse: his mercy endures for ever.
